pr_title: Apply macOS integrations even with custom look and feel

timeline.bodyText:
This else if really confused me here.
What is the Nimbus Look & Feel Class and why is it incompatible with MacOS?
timeline.author: J12934

replies.bodyText: It's not about incompatibility but use the most appropriate (prettier?) look and feel by default when running on macOS.
replies.author: thc202

replies.bodyText:
Ah ok. But this else if would only run for non macOS Systems, right?
So all non macOS System use Nimbus and macOS by default uses the last line (setLookAndFeel(UIManager.getSystemLookAndFeelClassName());) of the method.
replies.author: J12934

replies.bodyText:
Ok understood. Thank you! 👏
Will push a small change to make sure that behavior is kept.
replies.author: J12934

replies.bodyText:
Just to be clear:

So all non macOS System use Nimbus

They default to Nimbus, but can still use other L&F.
replies.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText:
Will push a small change to make sure that behavior is kept.

Thanks. The if moved above should be done after lookAndFeelSet = true;, it's not necessary to do that more than once.
replies.author: thc202
